arts.ttl: Fury and anger from the boss as Stevenage held to draw by Mansfield Town
arts.sum: However, in the space of two minutes Boro felt they should have had a penalty for handball and then were gobsmacked as a Baily Cargill tackle on Jordan Roberts as he went in on goal was only deemed a yellow card. â€œI was told [Jordan Roberts] had lost control of the ball when he's through on goal so it's yellow and then the handball is just so obvious, there are no players in his way.

arts.ttl: Stevenage furious after being held to a 1-1 draw by Mansfield
arts.sum: Brandon Hanlan and Kemp got in each other's way as they chased the same ball forward and while Nick Freeman and Dan Phillips kept the move alive, Louis Thompson this time overhit the pass back to Kemp. Cargill was then fortunate to stay on the pitch as he fouled Roberts as the Boro man pinched a loose ball off him and went forward, in on goal.

arts.ttl: Jordan Rhodes equaliser earns Mansfield a point at Stevenage

arts.sum: Stevenage picked up a rare victory - just their second since early-February - against Cambridge in midweek to keep them in the top half of the League One table. Another victory here would put the Bor...

arts.ttl: Alex Revell defends first half performance as Stevenage beat Cambridge United
arts.sum: It was a deserved success and Revell was quick to point out, despite an interruption that made him smile, that without that first period, you wouldn't have got the second-half show. "I can still hear the fans," he said with a big grin, "it's amazing," before continuing "no, second half we were a little bit more organised in terms of a few bits in midfield.
